items.summary: Convert the project into a frontend-only, fully static React/Vite site suitable for Netlify deployment by removing the Internet Computer backend canister code and IC-specific build/deploy configuration from the repo.

Remove Internet Identity and backend actor usage from the runtime by switching the app entrypoint to a new static-only bootstrap file without editing any frontend immutable paths (do not edit `frontend/src/main.tsx` or the immutable II/actor hooks files).

Update the Contact form so it does not attempt any backend/canister submission and remains visually unchanged; it must behave as a static frontend-only form (e.g., local-only submission handling with an on-screen success/failure message) while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Make the deployment Netlify-friendly for an SPA: add Netlify configuration and redirects so all routes (Home/About/Solutions/Contact and any deep links) load correctly on refresh and direct navigation.

Keep the visible frontend UI/appearance unchanged while performing the frontend-only conversion (no intentional layout, styling, copy, or content changes except where necessary to remove backend-only functionality).
